item.title: Obama signs 'Blue Alert' law to protect police
item.description:
Obama signs 'Blue Alert' law to protect police

WASHINGTON - President Obama has signed into law a measure that will require instant nationwide "Blue Alerts" to warn about threats to police officers and help track down the suspects who carry them out. The Rafael Ramos and Wenjian Liu National Blue Alert Act of 2015 is named for the two New York Police Department officers killed in an ambush attack last December.

item.title: US and Cuba in talks to bring cop-killer back to America
item.description:
US and Cuba in talks to bring cop-killer back to America

US and Cuban officials are reportedly discussing an exchange that could bring New Jersey cop killer Joanne Chesimard back to American soil. The talks between the two countries, which have normalized diplomatic relations, could also send notorious Cuban spy Ana Montes back to the Caribbean nation, according to NBC.

item.title: King Tut's Knife Was Made From A Meteorite
item.description:
King Tut's Knife Was Made From A Meteorite

Scientists say an iron knife buried with King Tut is truly out of this world. The knife was made with iron that came from a meteorite, according to an article in the journal Meteoritics and Planetary Science published online last month.

item.title: Bayer Sold HIV-Risky Meds
item.description:
Bayer Sold HIV-Risky Meds

Chemical and drug maker Bayer AG said Thursday it acted "responsibly, ethically and humanely" during the 1980s in selling a blood-clotting product that stopped potentially fatal bleeding in hemophiliacs but was linked to the risk of HIV infection.

item.title: Catholic Church hired lobby firms to block N.Y. kid-rape laws
item.description:
Catholic Church hired lobby firms to block N.Y. kid-rape laws

ALBANY - Not leaving it to divine chance, the state Catholic Conference has turned in recent years to some of Albany's most well-connected and influential lobby firms to help block a bill that would make it easier for child sex abuse victims to seek justice.

item.title: 'Rambo' Gets 20 Years for Drug and Murder Plots, but His Boss's Fate Remains a Mystery | VICE News
item.description:
'Rambo' Gets 20 Years for Drug and Murder Plots, but His Boss's Fate Remains a Mystery | VICE News

A federal judge in Manhattan closed another chapter in the stranger-than-fiction case of the real-life "Rambo" on Tuesday, sentencing 51-year-old former US Army sniper instructor Joseph Manuel Hunter to 20 years in prison on drug, weapons, and murder-for-hire charges.

item.title: First Hudson Yards Tower Set to Open
item.description:
First Hudson Yards Tower Set to Open

At 52 stories, the glass-and-concrete skyscraper on Manhattan's far West Side has been detailed in dozens of glossy renderings and constructed in miniature for tabletop models. Now, the first building in the massive Hudson Yards project is finally to scale and ready for business.

item.title: Prince Died of 'Self-Administered' Fentanyl Overdose, Autopsy Results Show | VICE News
item.description:
Prince Died of 'Self-Administered' Fentanyl Overdose, Autopsy Results Show | VICE News

Music superstar Prince, who was found dead in his home in a Minneapolis suburb in late April, died of an accidental, self-administered overdose of an opioid painkiller, the county medical examiner said in a death report on Thursday.

item.title: UCLA On Lockdown Amid Reports Of Shooting
item.description:
UCLA On Lockdown Amid Reports Of Shooting

The University of California in Los Angeles is on lockdown after reports of a possible shooting in an engineering building. BruinAlert: Shooting at Engineering 4. Go to secure location and deny entry (lockdown) now!- UCLA Bruin Alert (@UCLABruinAlert) June 1, 2016 A spokesperson for the LAPD said they had no information at this time, but UCLA said police were investigating a possible shooter at Boelter Hall.

item.title: We Saw Prophets of Rage Make Their Live Debut, and No Surprise, They're Political as Shit | NOISEY
item.description:
We Saw Prophets of Rage Make Their Live Debut, and No Surprise, They're Political as Shit | NOISEY

Debuting at Sunset Strip staple the Whisky A Go Go was a curious way for newly formed supergroup Prophets of Rage to launch their campaign. The venue, now known primarily for its metal and pay-for-play bookings, doesn't seem like the immediate go-to for a group grounded in hip-hop to make their grand debut.
